description.narrative: By 2015, health workers, mothers and families have the skills and knowledge needed to improve young infant, child and maternal nutrition outcomes for optimum health and development., which contributes to Child Health, Community-Based Management Of Acute Malnutrition, Hygiene, Infant And Young Child Feeding, Nutrition And Emergencies, Nutrition â€“ General, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Sanitation, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, the capacities of the Government and relevant stakeholders are strengthened to improve quality, access and utilization of maternal, newborn, child and adolescent health services, including sexual and reproductive health.

sector.narrative: Breastfeeding protection, promotion and support (including work on Code)
Capacity building for nutrition preparedness and response
Care for children with severe acute malnutrition
HSS - Risk informed programming including climate resilience disaster and conflict
Hygiene - handwashing with soap in communities
Immunization supply chain, including cold chain
Technical assistance - Treatment of severe acute malnutrition
Vitamin A supplementation in early childhood (children under 5)

Papua New Guinea Country Programme Document 2018-2022
UNICEF Policy on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF Procedure on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF procedure for programme implementation partnerships
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Papua New Guinea 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2015, health workers, mothers and families have the skills and knowledge needed to improve young infant, child and maternal nutrition outcomes for optimum health and development.
Number of priority districts supported in planning and implementation of infant and young child feeding activities
Number of districts implementing integrated awareness activities on promoting breastfeeding.
National Nutrition Policy reviewed, strategy and action plan developed and adopted.
